units.name: Baneblade
units.description: Super-heavy tank unit with devastating firepower.
units.flavour: The Baneblade is an unmistakable icon of the Imperium's armoured supremacy, and many of these honoured machines have served in countless war zones across several millennia of war. Possessed of overwhelming firepower, exceptionally thick armour, and a roaring power-plant that allows it to surge into battle with surprising speed, the Baneblade is a truly deadly foe in any conflict.

units.name: Basilisk
units.description: Long-range artillery tank unit.
units.flavour: When the Imperial Guard go to war, they march to the thunderous report of batteries of Basilisks whose guns can flatten cities and end worlds. Instantly recognisable for the long, looming barrel of its earthshaker cannon, the Basilisk boasts a prodigious range.

units.name: Chimera
units.description: Amphibious transport unit with manned weaponry and communication equipment.
units.flavour: The Chimera is the most prolific and popular armoured transport used by the Imperial Guard. It is rugged, versatile, and easy to produce in huge numbers. For thousands of years it has been accepted wisdom that the Chimera punches well above its weight in a firefight; the tank itself mounts a variety of punishing anti-personnel weaponry, while passengers can lay down additional fire from its spacious top hatch and flank-mounted lasgun arrays.

units.name: Bullgryn
units.description: Heavy melee infantry unit.
units.flavour: Bullgryns are clad in custom-made carapace armour and carry crude assault weaponry to capitalise on the abhumans' stature and resilience. These units provide their comrades with a wall of walking cover as they advance across the battlefield, soaking up vast volumes of enemy fire in the process.

units.name: Guardsman
units.description: Light infantry unit.
units.flavour: From the steaming jungles of Catachan to the war-torn fortress world of Cadia, the humble Guardsmen provide the ironclad backbone of the Imperial Guard.

units.name: Headquarters
units.description: Headquarters unit that represents a city's defenses.
units.flavour: The central administrative building of any Imperial colony, the magnificent Basilica is a temple to bureaucracy. Generations of plain-clad clerks live and die amidst tottering tomes, deciding the fate of star systems with the feeble thump of their stamps. As the saying goes, the Inquisition may burn you, the Astartes smite you—but only the Adeptus Administratum can torment you for your entire life.

units.name: HeavyWeaponsSquad
units.description: Infantry unit equipped to deal with heavily armoured targets.
units.flavour: Infantry heavy weapons are typically crewed by a team of two men; one fires the weapon while the other supplies the ammunition, and between them they can relocate their weapon if needs be.

units.name: Hydra
units.description: Fast tank unit that excels against airborne targets.
units.flavour: Whether faced by lightning-fast xenos fighters or daemonic, leather-winged monstrosities, the Hydra Flak Tank is ideally equipped to blow aerial foes out of the sky. The Hydra's predictive logic-spirit singles out and locks onto its targets with the tenacity of a predatory beast.

units.name: ImperialStrongpoint
units.description: Fortification with heavy bolters that can shelter infantry.
units.flavour: An Imperial Bastion is an imposing edifice built from foot-thick ferrocrete and the remains of faithful servants of the Imperium. As they are relatively easy to construct, some planets boast networks of Bastions that span entire continents. Built to withstand orbital strikes and artillery bombardments, there are few weapons capable of razing them in a single blow. It is with good reason that such fortresses often form the cornerstone of a planet's defensive strategy.

units.name: LordCommissar
units.description: Hero unit that provides bonuses to nearby allied units.
units.flavour: Amongst the ranks of the Officio Prefectus there are many heroic individuals who have become legend through their deeds. A Lord Commissar is expected to exemplify everything the Imperium strives toward.

units.name: LemanRussBattleTank
units.description: Heavily armoured main battle tank unit.
units.flavour: The Leman Russ battle tank is an ironclad declaration of might made manifest. They are the mainstay of the Imperial Guard's armoured forces, lumbering slabs of armour and intolerance whose inexorable advance has ground a billion foes of the Imperium to bloody ruin.

units.name: MarauderBomber
units.description: Super-heavy bomber unit that obliterates ground targets.
units.flavour: Sturdily built and boasting a colossal payload for its size, the Marauder is the archetypal heavy bomber of the Imperium. Powerful engines and capacious fuel tanks give the Marauder a substantial operational reach and, furthermore, allow bomber squadrons to operate effectively in times of sporadic resupply.

units.name: PrimarisPsyker
units.description: Hero unit with destructive psychic powers.
units.flavour: Loathed and feared as witches by their superstitious comrades, Primaris Psykers are nonetheless valuable assets to any commander. Though it hardly lessens the constant suspicion they are held in by the Officio Prefectus, each of these psykers possess abilities and control far beyond those of lesser Scholastica Psykana initiates.

units.name: Ratling
units.description: Sniper infantry unit that can move after shooting.
units.flavour: Though less resilient than their human comrades, Ratlings are naturally excellent shots. It is said that Ratling marksmen can take the head off a heretic from over a kilometre away. Coupled with their knack for staying out of harm’s way, this makes Ratlings formidable snipers who can take a surprising toll upon superior enemy forces.

units.name: ScoutSentinel
units.description: Light armoured walker unit specialized in reconnaissance.
units.flavour: The Sentinel is a fast-moving combat walker employed to scout dense terrain and provide close infantry fire support. With surprising speed and locomotive dexterity, Sentinels can traverse terrain that would confound other armoured vehicles. The lighter-armoured Scout Sentinels, in particular, are used to range ahead of the main battle line, setting up brutal ambushes or launching pin-point raids.

units.name: TechpriestEnginseer
units.description: Infantry unit that supports vehicles, clears tiles and founds new cities.
units.flavour: Tech-Priest Enginseers serve as custodians for the vehicles of the Imperial Guard. With binary prayers and mystic rites, the Enginseers soothe the machine spirits of their tracked congregation. Without the diligent maintenance of the Enginseers, the Imperial Guard would soon find themselves without the heavy armour vital to their very survival.

units.name: TempestusScion
units.description: Elite shock infantry unit.
units.flavour: Militarum Tempestus Scions are often viewed with fear or resentment by the regular troops—nicknames such as 'glory boys' and 'big toy soldiers' are common. Yet this rancour is nothing to the Scions themselves. Trained in covert operations and rapid insertion strike-tactics, they go to battle confident that their every deed is for the good of the Imperium itself.

units.name: TankCommander
units.description: Tank hero unit with formidable strength that also boosts nearby allied tank units.
units.flavour: A Tank Commander rides to battle in the cupola of a mighty Leman Russ battle tank. These grizzled men are virtually one with their machine, possessing an implicit knowledge of armoured warfare in all its forms. The average Tank Commander is a steely eyed ace, heading up a crew of the very best their regiment has to offer.

units.name: Thunderbolt
units.description: Fast and heavy fighter unit.
units.flavour: A heavy fighter that combines devastating strike potential with graceful speed and manoeuvrability, the Thunderbolt forms the bulk of the Imperial Navy's intra-atmosphere fighter aircraft. The Thunderbolt is a true workhorse, with a rugged and reliable design both venerated by its crews and respected by its enemies.

units.name: VoidShieldGenerator
units.description: Fortification that shields units in range.
units.flavour: Void shields are normally localised force fields reserved for protecting the monolithic Titans of the Adeptus Mechanicus, but static generators can be erected to serve as an aegis for other targets of vital import. The largest Void Shield generators can even project an invisible bubble of power across a large area of the battlefield, sheltering both troops and strategically vital battlefield locations by absorbing or deflecting the energy of incoming munitions.

units.name: Valkyrie
units.description: Versatile airborne transport unit.
units.flavour: The Valkyrie Assault Carrier is a well-armed, twin-engine attack craft. The durable armour and versatile payload of the Valkyrie chassis combine with the aircraft's powerful engines and stable handling to make it a popular choice for a broad spectrum of battlefield roles.

units.name: WyrdvanePsyker
units.description: Psyker unit that specializes in debuffs.
units.flavour: Wyrdvane Psykers transform the howling might of the Warp into a deadly weapon of Imperial supremacy. They are formed from those Scholastica Psykana inductees not able to control their burgeoning powers without guidance and aid. As individuals, such psykers are unpredictable and unsafe. Yet working in concert, these deadly mutants can be a valuable asset.

buildings.name: Aircraft
buildings.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates ore and influence.
buildings.flavour: This landing field was designed for larger craft—almost up to the intra-system scale—but with the endless warpstorms, it's been repurposed to house the Imperial air forces. Much like a Skyshield landing pad, it has limited field generators to protect grounded aircraft from incoming fire.

buildings.name: Energy
buildings.flavour: Whilst the ancients may have split the atom, the Empire's Techpriests have had millennia to perfect the rituals by which they draw up power. The open-core Plasma Ioniser uses coolant-infusion systems to maintain an output of around 100 petawatts for up to a hundred days at a time—around 10,000 times that of the largest historical fission plant.

buildings.name: Construction
buildings.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates food and ore.
buildings.flavour: Whilst the Administratum runs the entire Empire of man, the Departmento Munitorum is tasked solely with supplying the manpower and supplies for the Astra Militarum. Among their many tasks is the construction of large facilities, such as airfields or orbital stations. The poor grunts who have to do the work are the Labour Corps, indentured or penal workers and mind-wiped servitors.

buildings.name: Food
buildings.flavour: Soylens viridians might be filling, nutritious and easy to grow in great vats—but as a foodstuff it has some drawbacks. First, it's utterly bland and flavourless. Second, it looks like green gloop. Third, it's made from any available organic matter. Persistent rumour has it that human corpses are not excluded.

buildings.name: Headquarters
buildings.flavour: The central administrative building of any Imperial colony, the magnificent Basilica is a temple to bureaucracy. Generations of plain-clad clerks live and die amidst tottering tomes, deciding the fate of star systems with the feeble thump of their stamps. As the saying goes, the Inquisition may burn you, the Astartes smite you—but only the Adeptus Administratum can torment you for your entire life.

buildings.name: Heroes
buildings.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: Far more than a mere statue, this great metal eagle was cast from the molten remains of space-faring vessels, and serves as an inspiration for those nearby. The Imperial troops that fight under the Aquila's ceaseless vigil find a new determination welling in their hearts, knowing that they are the last in a line of heroes that stretches across the stars.

buildings.name: Housing
buildings.flavour: The classic Imperial structure, these identikit city buildings are seen all over the Empire. They provide the minimum amount of shelter and comfort required for the people of the Imperium to eke out their short lives. At a colony's founding, sometimes they're built in situ—but more often, on remote planets, they're dropped directly from any colonising spaceships.

buildings.name: Infantry
buildings.description: Building that produces infantry as well as increases population limit and loyalty.
buildings.flavour: Whilst the training of recruits to the Imperial Guard has none of the harrowing horrors suffered by Astartes initiates, the Munitorum still has to drill the strictures of the Empire into the tithed men and women that make up most Guard regiments. Here, at the Barracks, a planet's unpromising conscripts are turned into the true Astra Militarum—by giving them uniforms, guns and perhaps even some training.

buildings.name: Loyalty
buildings.flavour: The local seat of the Imperial Cult may appear dark and gothic, but is in fact a hallowed place. Adorned by statues of saints, it is a venerated local symbol of the Emperor's godlike will, and provides inspiration to the nearby populace.

buildings.name: Ore
buildings.flavour: Depending on the planet, extraction of metal ores and valuable minerals is undertaken by anything ranging from ancient-tech machinery barely controlled by its Techpriest magos to thousands of Labour Corp workers, playing their part in the war to save mankind.

buildings.name: Influence
buildings.flavour: Though artificial intelligence is an abomination, long abhorred since the fall of the Men of Iron, the archaic data looms of the Adeptus Administratum bear little resemblance to ancient computers or even to the slim microprocessors used by the Techpriests of Mars. Cogitators functions are purely bureaucratic, their form immobile. Still, their capabilities are prized by every Imperial world purely for their inhuman memory.

buildings.name: Psykers
buildings.description: Building that produces psykers as well as generates energy and influence.
buildings.flavour: Whilst the warpstorm rages, the peacetime use of psykers—as astropaths, for long-range communication—is pointless. Similarly, without being able to reach the Black Ships, unwanted psykers can't be transported to Terra for sacrifice at the Golden Throne. Instead, most are executed, with a select few drafted into Imperial service as Sanctioned Psykers.

buildings.name: Research
buildings.flavour: Learning to be an officer of the Astra Militarum is a thankless, often lethal task. One of the safest postings is to the Officio Tactica, where the smartest tactical minds analyse ongoing military manouevres and refer to the copious texts of the Tactica Imperialis for well-tested advice. They also record their current campaigns, so that future generations might learn from them.

buildings.name: Upgrades
buildings.description: Building that produces Techpriest Enginseers and generates research.
buildings.flavour: The Techpriests worship of 'the Omnissiah', a machine-god, would surely be frowned upon, were it not for their usefulness. Instead, a tacit agreement is in place; the Techpriests acknowledge publicly that the Emperor was the Omnissiah and the Administratum agrees not to pry too closely.

buildings.name: Vehicles
buildings.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates ore and research.
buildings.flavour: To call an Imperial Manufactorum a 'factory' is akin to calling a Catachan Devil an insect. These cyclopean structures are huge, forbidding temples to the Machine God, wherein his miracles—here vehicles of war—are created. Inside them, lowly menials are doomed to never see the planet's surface, as they ceaselessly minister to the blessed engines of Mars.

upgrades.name: Aircraft
upgrades.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates ore and influence.
upgrades.flavour: This landing field was designed for larger craft—almost up to the intra-system scale—but with the endless warpstorms, it's been repurposed to house the Imperial air forces. Much like a Skyshield landing pad, it has limited field generators to protect grounded aircraft from incoming fire.

upgrades.name: AircraftProductionEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the production output of Voidports in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all voidport overseers. Labourer sleep cycles are halved until further notice, production targets are raised. Arbitrators are being deployed to all sectors to ensure compliance.

upgrades.name: AdditionalHeavyBolters
upgrades.description: Grants Baneblades, Leman Russ Battle Tanks and Valkyries extra Heavy Bolters.
upgrades.flavour: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.

upgrades.name: BanebladeLascannon
upgrades.description: Grants Baneblades extra lascannons.
upgrades.flavour: Las weapons fire packets of explosive laser energy—the larger the gun, the more powerful the shot. Regardless of size, las weapons are incredibly reliable, making them favoured tools of war throughout the Imperium.

upgrades.name: AwakenTheMachine
upgrades.description: Grants Techpriest Enginseers the ability to boost the damage of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour:
“With push of Button fire the Engine
And spark Turbine into life…
Toll the Great Bell Thrice!
Sing Praise to the
God of All Machines”
— Catechism of the Autoculus of Mars

upgrades.name: Baneblade
upgrades.description: Super-heavy tank unit with devastating firepower.
upgrades.flavour: The Baneblade is an unmistakable icon of the Imperium's armoured supremacy, and many of these honoured machines have served in countless war zones across several millennia of war. Possessed of overwhelming firepower, exceptionally thick armour, and a roaring power-plant that allows it to surge into battle with surprising speed, the Baneblade is a truly deadly foe in any conflict.

upgrades.name: Basilisk
upgrades.description: Long-range artillery tank unit.
upgrades.flavour: When the Imperial Guard go to war, they march to the thunderous report of batteries of Basilisks whose guns can flatten cities and end worlds. Instantly recognisable for the long, looming barrel of its earthshaker cannon, the Basilisk boasts a prodigious range.

upgrades.name: BlastDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of grenade, missile and blast weapons.
upgrades.flavour: By using a more advanced engraving protocol on the casing, the lethality of explosive is much improved.

upgrades.name: CamoNetting
upgrades.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of ground vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: Whether rare cameleoline netting or crude webbing woven with local flora, camo netting helps conceal a vehicle from prying eyes.

upgrades.name: BoltDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of bolt weapons.
upgrades.flavour: An Astartes-derived upgrade to the standard bolter, this kit allows a bolter to fire Kraken penetrator rounds, hard-tipped projectiles with a heavier explosive charge. These heavier rounds are much favoured by the Space Marine Deathwatch alien hunters.

upgrades.name: Bullgryn
upgrades.description: Heavy melee infantry unit.
upgrades.flavour: Bullgryns are clad in custom-made carapace armour and carry crude assault weaponry to capitalise on the abhumans' stature and resilience. These units provide their comrades with a wall of walking cover as they advance across the battlefield, soaking up vast volumes of enemy fire in the process.

upgrades.name: ChaffLauncher
upgrades.description: Grants Thunderbolts and Marauder Bombers the ability to launch chaffs that increase ranged damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: Since the earliest days of airborne combat, some form of lightweight material has been used to distract enemy pilots. Today's chaff would be unrecognizable to those early airmen, but its efficacy against modern countermeasures is about the same.

upgrades.name: BruteShield
upgrades.description: Increases the damage and damage reduction of Bullgryns.
upgrades.flavour: These shields resemble large and resilient energised bucklers. They are carried by some Bullgryns, serving equally well in combat as a defensive measure and handy bludgeon.

upgrades.name: Chimera
upgrades.description: Amphibious transport unit with manned weaponry and communication equipment.
upgrades.flavour: The Chimera is the most prolific and popular armoured transport used by the Imperial Guard. It is rugged, versatile, and easy to produce in huge numbers. For thousands of years it has been accepted wisdom that the Chimera punches well above its weight in a firefight; the tank itself mounts a variety of punishing anti-personnel weaponry, while passengers can lay down additional fire from its spacious top hatch and flank-mounted lasgun arrays.

upgrades.name: CityTier2
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: One day, this will be a Hive City—a billion people in one structure, towering over a poisoned world—but first, this settlement needs to expand a little, to set the foundations for the galaxies' biggest conurbations.

upgrades.name: CityTier3
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: The Departmento Munitorum might be inefficient, but they can plan and the Techpriest Explorators and Servitors can build. These bunkered tunnels allow the Astra Militarum commander to oversee a much larger city area, without losing defensive control.

upgrades.name: Construction
upgrades.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates food and ore.
upgrades.flavour: Whilst the Administratum runs the entire Empire of man, the Departmento Munitorum is tasked solely with supplying the manpower and supplies for the Astra Militarum. Among their many tasks is the construction of large facilities, such as airfields or orbital stations. The poor grunts who have to do the work are the Labour Corps, indentured or penal workers and mind-wiped servitors.

upgrades.name: EnergyEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the energy output of Plasma Ionisers in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all power unit overseers. Safeguards are to be removed on all plasma ionisers; the labour Corps has been mandated to replenish manpower depleted by resulting meltdowns without further authorisation.

upgrades.name: DozerBlade
upgrades.description: Reduces the movement penalty for tanks in forests and imperial ruins.
upgrades.flavour: Dozer blades are heavy ploughs, blades, rams, or scoops, used to clear obstacles from the vehicle's path.

upgrades.name: DefenseEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the armour of units in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Astra Militarum: to all General Staff, Regimental Commanders, Company Commanders. All units are to be kept under or behind protective cover at all times, even during R&R. Additional resource expenditure for defense repairs is authorised.

upgrades.name: ExtraVehicleArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: Adding extra armour plates to tanks might be the height of heresy for Tech-Priests, but for the soldiers of the Astra Militarum it's the norm. Ablative plating or custom armour for dealing with particular weapons isn't unheard of.

upgrades.name: ExtraInfantryArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of infantry.
upgrades.flavour: Most infantry in the 41st millenium are equipped with flak armour or its equivalent. If a commander wants their troops to have more than a slight chance of survival, they'll equip them with something closer to the Astra Militarum armaplas-derived carapace armour.

upgrades.name: FoodEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the food output of Soylens Farms in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all Imperial subjects. Personal rations are reduced with immediate effect. Arbitrators have been dispatched to farms, granaries and storehouses to ensure compliance.

upgrades.name: GrowthEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the growth rate of the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all registered insula keepers. For the period of this Edict, connubial encounters are encouraged. Also, to all Imperial storehouse overseers. For the period of this Edict, anaphrodisiac dosages are to be eliminated from both the food and water supply.

upgrades.name: FragGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Bullgryns, Guardsmen, Heavy Weapons Squads, Lord Commissars, Primaris Psykers, Techpriest Enginseers and Tempestus Scions the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.
upgrades.flavour: The lethal storm of shrapnel from these grenades drives opponents further under the cover for a few precious moments, allowing attackers more time to close in and, hopefully, get the first blow in against a disoriented foe.

upgrades.name: Heroes
upgrades.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: Far more than a mere statue, this great metal eagle was cast from the molten remains of space-faring vessels, and serves as an inspiration for those nearby. The Imperial troops that fight under the Aquila's ceaseless vigil find a new determination welling in their hearts, knowing that they are the last in a line of heroes that stretches across the stars.

upgrades.name: HammerOfWrath
upgrades.description: Grants Scout Sentinels and Bullgryns the ability to perform more devastating attacks.
upgrades.flavour: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

upgrades.name: HeavyWeaponsSquad
upgrades.description: Infantry unit equipped to deal with heavily armoured targets.
upgrades.flavour: Infantry heavy weapons are typically crewed by a team of two men; one fires the weapon while the other supplies the ammunition, and between them they can relocate their weapon if needs be.

upgrades.name: Housing
upgrades.description: Building that increases population limit.
upgrades.flavour: The classic Imperial structure, these identikit city buildings are seen all over the Empire. They provide the minimum amount of shelter and comfort required for the people of the Imperium to eke out their short lives. At a colony's founding, sometimes they're built in situ—but more often, on remote planets, they're dropped directly from any colonising spaceships.

upgrades.name: HunterKillerMissile
upgrades.description: Grants ground vehicles the ability to fire hunter-killer missiles.
upgrades.flavour: Hunter-killer missiles are commonly fitted to Imperial vehicles. These single-use weapon systems allow vehicles such as Rhinos to engage armoured enemy vehicles that would otherwise far outmatch them.

upgrades.name: Hydra
upgrades.description: Fast tank unit that excels against airborne targets.
upgrades.flavour: Whether faced by lightning-fast xenos fighters or daemonic, leather-winged monstrosities, the Hydra Flak Tank is ideally equipped to blow aerial foes out of the sky. The Hydra's predictive logic-spirit singles out and locks onto its targets with the tenacity of a predatory beast.

upgrades.name: ImperialSplendour
upgrades.description: Increases the influence of Astra Militarum cities.
upgrades.flavour: A successful planetary governor will reflect his domain's newfound wealth with monuments to the Imperium—mammoth plascrete basilica and statues of Space Marines, Primarchs and the Emperor.

upgrades.name: InfantryProductionEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the production output of Imperial Barracks in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Astra Militarum: to all Commissars and recruitment officers. Volunteering sweeps are to be doubled, the Emperor's Mercy is to be applied to all recusants.

upgrades.name: ImperialStrongpoint
upgrades.description: Grants Techpriest Enginseers the ability to construct fortifications with Heavy Bolters.
upgrades.flavour: An Imperial Bastion is an imposing edifice built from foot-thick ferrocrete and the remains of faithful servants of the Imperium. As they are relatively easy to construct, some planets boast networks of Bastions that span entire continents. Built to withstand orbital strikes and artillery bombardments, there are few weapons capable of razing them in a single blow. It is with good reason that such fortresses often form the cornerstone of a planet's defensive strategy.

upgrades.name: KrakGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Guardsmen, Heavy Weapons Squads, Lord Commissars, Techpriest Enginseers and Tempestus Scions the ability to throw anti-armour grenades.
upgrades.flavour: Krak grenades are implosive charges designed to crack vehicle armour.

upgrades.name: LasDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of las weapons.
upgrades.flavour: These superior modular packs convert the standard lasgun into a 'Hellgun', with improved range and power, but reduced power pack capacity and degraded reliability, requiring constant maintenance. Even units that already have dedicated Hotshot lasguns benefit from more reliable Hotshot power pack supplies.

upgrades.name: LemanRussBattleTank
upgrades.description: Heavily armoured main battle tank unit.
upgrades.flavour: The Leman Russ battle tank is an ironclad declaration of might made manifest. They are the mainstay of the Imperial Guard's armoured forces, lumbering slabs of armour and intolerance whose inexorable advance has ground a billion foes of the Imperium to bloody ruin.

upgrades.name: Loyalty
upgrades.description: Building that increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: The local seat of the Imperial Cult may appear dark and gothic, but is in fact a hallowed place. Adorned by statues of saints, it is a venerated local symbol of the Emperor's godlike will, and provides inspiration to the nearby populace.

upgrades.name: LoyaltyEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the loyalty output of Sancti Imperialum in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Adeptus Arbites: to all Commissars, Arbitrators and Enforcers: a period of increased Imperial communication has been commissioned. During this time, insula-to-insula searches are now authorised in order to ensure maximum devotion to the Emperor. Chasteners are to apply the Lex Imperialis rigorously.

upgrades.name: MarauderBomber
upgrades.description: Super-heavy bomber unit that obliterates ground targets.
upgrades.flavour: Sturdily built and boasting a colossal payload for its size, the Marauder is the archetypal heavy bomber of the Imperium. Powerful engines and capacious fuel tanks give the Marauder a substantial operational reach and, furthermore, allow bomber squadrons to operate effectively in times of sporadic resupply.

upgrades.name: MediPack
upgrades.description: Grants Guardsmen and Tempestus Scions the ability to heal themselves during combat.
upgrades.flavour: Medi-packs contain all the necessary drugs, dressings and surgical tools to get a wounded Imperial Guardsman back in the fight, or save the lives of vital personnel.

upgrades.name: Misfortune
upgrades.description: Grants Wyrdvane Psykers the ability to curse enemy units so they take increased damage.
upgrades.flavour: With a click of his fingers, the diviner twists fate so that his followers' blows punch through the weakest points in their opponent's armour.

upgrades.name: OreEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the ore output of Ore Extractors in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all manufactory overseers: servitors are required to be run continuously for this cycle. Burnouts / fatalities are to be replaced from the lower ranks of the penal and labour corps.

upgrades.name: Psykers
upgrades.description: Building that produces psykers as well as generates energy and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Whilst the warpstorm rages, the peacetime use of psykers—as astropaths, for long-range communication—is pointless. Similarly, without being able to reach the Black Ships, unwanted psykers can't be transported to Terra for sacrifice at the Golden Throne. Instead, most are executed, with a select few drafted into Imperial service as Sanctioned Psykers.

upgrades.name: PrimarisPsyker
upgrades.description: Hero unit with destructive psychic powers.
upgrades.flavour: Loathed and feared as witches by their superstitious comrades, Primaris Psykers are nonetheless valuable assets to any commander. Though it hardly lessens the constant suspicion they are held in by the Officio Prefectus, each of these psykers possess abilities and control far beyond those of lesser Scholastica Psykana initiates.

upgrades.name: PsykerProductionEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the production output of Psyker Covens in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Adeptus Astra Telepathica: to the Coven Masters and magisters of the Scholastia Psykana. Quality thresholds for recruitment have been lowered; summary executions should thus be minimal, blanks excepted. Assign all recruits to a Sanctioned Psyker immediately.

upgrades.name: Ratling
upgrades.description: Sniper infantry unit that can move after shooting.
upgrades.flavour: Though less resilient than their human comrades, Ratlings are naturally excellent shots. It is said that Ratling marksmen can take the head off a heretic from over a kilometre away. Coupled with their knack for staying out of harm’s way, this makes Ratlings formidable snipers who can take a surprising toll upon superior enemy forces.

upgrades.name: RecoveryGear
upgrades.description: Increases the healing rate for ground vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: Many crews load their vehicles with collections of tools, tow cables and other useful kit that can make the difference between digging an immobilized vehicle out of a tight spot or having to abandon it to its fate.

upgrades.name: ResearchEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the research output of Officiis Tacticas in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Adeptus Mechanicus: to all Tech-Priests. During this cycle, the Quest for Knowledge takes precedence. Studies of STC designs, exploratory missions are to be encouraged. Praise the Omnissiah!

upgrades.name: SkystrikeMissile
upgrades.description: Grants Thunderbolts anti-air missiles.
upgrades.flavour: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

upgrades.name: RelicPlating
upgrades.description: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of ground vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: Occasionally a crew will achieve an empathic relationship with the machine spirit of their battle tank. When such a crew perishes, their remains may be interred within their vehicle, spirits lingering protectively to drive away the baleful energies of the void.

upgrades.name: SmokeLauncher
upgrades.description: Grants ground vehicles the ability to launch a smoke screen that increases the ranged damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: Some vehicles have small launchers mounted onto them that carry smoke canisters. These are used to temporarily obscure the vehicle behind billowing clouds of smoke, allowing it to cross open areas in greater safety—although it does so at the cost of being able to fire its own weapons.

upgrades.name: TankCommander
upgrades.description: Tank hero unit with formidable strength that also boosts nearby allied tank units.
upgrades.flavour: A Tank Commander rides to battle in the cupola of a mighty Leman Russ battle tank. These grizzled men are virtually one with their machine, possessing an implicit knowledge of armoured warfare in all its forms. The average Tank Commander is a steely eyed ace, heading up a crew of the very best their regiment has to offer.

upgrades.name: TempestusScion
upgrades.description: Elite shock infantry unit.
upgrades.flavour: Militarum Tempestus Scions are often viewed with fear or resentment by the regular troops—nicknames such as 'glory boys' and 'big toy soldiers' are common. Yet this rancour is nothing to the Scions themselves. Trained in covert operations and rapid insertion strike-tactics, they go to battle confident that their every deed is for the good of the Imperium itself.

upgrades.name: Thunderbolt
upgrades.description: Fast and heavy fighter unit.
upgrades.flavour: A heavy fighter that combines devastating strike potential with graceful speed and manoeuvrability, the Thunderbolt forms the bulk of the Imperial Navy's intra-atmosphere fighter aircraft. The Thunderbolt is a true workhorse, with a rugged and reliable design both venerated by its crews and respected by its enemies.

upgrades.name: TrainedSentinelPilots
upgrades.description: Increases the damage of Scout Sentinels.
upgrades.flavour: Sentinels are used in a wide variety of roles throughout the Imperium of man—from power lifters used to load starship weaponry to open-canopy scouts. Some Sentinels are equipped with improved armour and stabilisers to carry heavier weaponry. This changes the Sentinel's role from support and reconnaissance to that of a heavy fire platform.

upgrades.name: VehicleProductionEdict
upgrades.description: Edict that increases the production output of Manufactorums in the city.
upgrades.flavour: Edict, Adeptus Mechanicus: to all Manufactorum Magi. Production quotas for this period are raised. Personal projects must be put on hold during this time. Additional resources / unguents will be provided for performance of the machine rites. Praise the Omnissiah!

upgrades.name: Vehicles
upgrades.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates ore and research.
upgrades.flavour: To call an Imperial Manufactorum a 'factory' is akin to calling a Catachan Devil an insect. These cyclopean structures are huge, forbidding temples to the Machine God, wherein his miracles—here vehicles of war—are created. Inside them, lowly menials are doomed to never see the planet's surface, as they ceaselessly minister to the blessed engines of Mars.

upgrades.name: Upgrades
upgrades.description: Building that produces Techpriest Enginseers and generates research.
upgrades.flavour: The Techpriests worship of 'the Omnissiah', a machine-god, would surely be frowned upon, were it not for their usefulness. Instead, a tacit agreement is in place; the Techpriests acknowledge publicly that the Emperor was the Omnissiah and the Administratum agrees not to pry too closely.

upgrades.name: VoidShieldGenerator
upgrades.description: Grants Techpriest Enginseers the ability to construct shield generators that grant ranged damage reduction to units in range.
upgrades.flavour: Void shields are normally localised force fields reserved for protecting the monolithic Titans of the Adeptus Mechanicus, but static generators can be erected to serve as an aegis for other targets of vital import. The largest Void Shield generators can even project an invisible bubble of power across a large area of the battlefield, sheltering both troops and strategically vital battlefield locations by absorbing or deflecting the energy of incoming munitions.

upgrades.name: VoxCaster
upgrades.description: Reduces the morale loss for Guardsmen and Tempestus Scions.
upgrades.flavour: A vox-caster is a reliable communications array connected to the tactical command net via tight-beam transmitters.
